required_header.download_date: Information obtained from ClinicalTrials.gov on October 20, 2011
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Spermatogonial Stem Cells in Azoospermic Patients: a Comparison Between Obstructive and Non-obstructive Azoospermia

brief_summary.textblock: The researchers hypothesized that nonobstructive azoospermia might be associated with a reduction OF SSCs in seminiferous tubules as compared with obstructive azoospermia. Testicular sperm specimens that had been previously extracted from azoospermic patients will be paraffin embedded and stained with anti GPR-125. After antigen retrieval, the sections will be incubated with rabbit anti GPR125 followed by Cy3-conjugated anti rabbit secondary antibodies. Those found to be SSCs will be counted using light microscopy, and compared between patients with obstructive (n=11) and non-obstructive azoospermia (n=9).

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective

primary_outcome.measure: SSCs were identified in both obstructive and nonobstructive azoospermia patients.

intervention.description: The sections will be incubated with rabbit anti GPR125 followed by Cy3-conjugated anti rabbit secondary antibodies.
The sections will be incubated with rabbit anti GPR125 followed by Cy3-conjugated anti rabbit secondary antibodies.

study_pop.textblock: Infertile male patients treated at the Hillel Yaffe Medical Center IVF Unit

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Azoospermic patients
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with sperm cells

facility.name: Hillel Yaffe Medical Center - IVF Unit
